definition: to pay a debt of gratitude/to repay a kindness

sentences.english: Remember when I helped you move?Well, now I need you to return the favor.
sentences.chinese: 還記得我曾經幫過你搬家嗎？現在是你報恩的時候了。

sentences.english: Throw our beehive and we'll save you.
sentences.chinese: 我們報恩的時候到了，扔出蜂巢你就能死裏逃生。

sentences.english: Small qian will I save from the trap, a matter of the gratitude will say.
sentences.chinese: 小倩將採臣救離陷阱，更將報恩之事說出。

sentences.english: Nine chitose predict prince and chicken three will have a big crisis, will have the opportunity to repay.
sentences.chinese: 九千歲預測太子和鳳三將有大劫，到時便有機會報恩。

sentences.english: Because of thanking, she use her life to help the man, to love the man.
sentences.chinese: 爲了報恩，她用她的生命去幫助他，愛他。

sentences.english: Dedication repays gratitude; repentance disciplines the self.
sentences.chinese: 奉獻是爲了報恩，懺悔是爲了律己。

sentences.english: Heart Association in gratitude for the opportunity to Boeun.
sentences.chinese: 感激的心總會在找機會報恩。

sentences.english: One day she will have a dog that will return the favors.
sentences.chinese: 將來的某一天，她會有隻報恩的小狗。

sentences.english: So, I hope to have a debt of gratitude section.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我希望能有個報恩節。

definition: used for 師傅|师傅 (in Taiwan)/master/qualified worker
righteousness/virtuous cause/a woman's marriage/main points of a piece of writing
to burn incense and worship Buddha
to accumulate merit/to do good/to give to charity/virtuous actions
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
